title: Team-Based Hybrid Social Problem-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Conducting Team Projects Combining Blended Learning (Online-Offline Parallel) and Collaborative Learning in a BYOD Environment

learning_goals: Learners can analyze social issue cases through team collaboration and propose solutions based on critical thinking.

Graduate students interact with peers and professors at least twice weekly (1 video conference, 1 LMS discussion) in a hybrid environment, and within six months, complete a team project involving problem definition (2 weeks), solution development (3 weeks), and implementation planning (3 weeks), culminating in a 10-page final report and 15-minute presentation.
Learners can evaluate effective team dynamics and derive improvement plans using team process reflection tools.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Miro)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
